title: Assistive Gardening Tools | From the Ground Up

tasks.task: Shopping for garden tools suitable for individuals with gardening accessibility issues
subtasks: Recognizing the need for garden tools that accommodate physical limitations
Considering tools with arched handles for better leverage
Evaluating longer handle tools for use from wheelchairs or standing positions
Assessing extendable handle options for adjustable reach
Examining hand tools designed for ground-level shrubbery access
Selecting watering tools adaptable for standing, sitting, or overhead plant watering
Asking garden centers for assistance in finding specific accessibility tools
Requesting information on publications or resources from university extension services
Ordering tools from online suppliers specializing in gardening accessibility
